node.title: Safe areas abortion bill passes with large majority in Parliament
node.description: Labour list MP Louisa Wall says the legislation on safe zones around abortion clinics sent a strong message women should be protected when accessing health services.
node.content:
["A bill allowing for the creation of safe zones around abortion clinics has passed its third and final reading.", "", "
Labour list MP Louisa Wall brought the legislation to the House. Photo: RNZ / Dom Thomas
", "The legislation prevents anti-abortion protests from intimidating or obstructing people accessing abortion services at some clinics.", "The safe zones don't automatically apply to all clinics and will be assessed on a case by case basis by both the Minister of Health and Minister of Justice.", "The Contraception, Sterilisation and Abortion (Safe Areas) Amendment Bill passed with 108 votes in favour and 12 opposed.", "Labour list MP Louisa Wall - whose name is on the bill - said it it sent a strong message women should be protected when accessing health services."]
